segment.source: Use the IExpress Wizard on Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1 to create self-extracting files to run your custom Internet Explorer Setup program.
segment.target: Use the IExpress Wizard on Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1 to create self-extracting files to run your custom Internet Explorer Setup program.

segment.source: IExpress Wizard for Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: IExpress Wizard for Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1 (Internet Explorer Administration Kit 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: IExpress Wizard for Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1
segment.target: IExpress Wizard for Windows Server 2008 R2 with SP1

segment.source: Use the IExpress Wizard and its associated command-line options to create self-extracting files that automatically run your custom Internet Explorer Setup (.inf or .exe file) program that’s contained inside.
segment.target: Use the IExpress Wizard and its associated command-line options to create self-extracting files that automatically run your custom Internet Explorer Setup (.inf or .exe file) program that’s contained inside.

segment.source: IExpress Wizard location
segment.target: IExpress Wizard location

segment.source: The IExpress Wizard (Iexpress.exe) is included as part of Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), in the folder.
segment.target: The IExpress Wizard (Iexpress.exe) is included as part of Windows Server 2008 R2 with Service Pack 1 (SP1), in the folder.

segment.source: The wizard uses a self-extraction directive (.sed) file to store your package’s information.
segment.target: The wizard uses a self-extraction directive (.sed) file to store your package’s information.

segment.source: When you run the wizard, you have the option to start with an existing .sed file or to create a new one.
segment.target: When you run the wizard, you have the option to start with an existing .sed file or to create a new one.

segment.source: IExpress Wizard features
segment.target: IExpress Wizard features

segment.source: The IExpress Wizard:
segment.target: The IExpress Wizard:

segment.source: Performs silent, unattended installations of your custom IE packages.
segment.target: Performs silent, unattended installations of your custom IE packages.

segment.source: Supports upgrading IE without removing previous installations.
segment.target: Supports upgrading IE without removing previous installations.

segment.source: Supports repeated updating or performing clean installations of the same IE build.
segment.target: Supports repeated updating or performing clean installations of the same IE build.

segment.source: IExpress Wizard settings
segment.target: IExpress Wizard settings

segment.source: The IExpress Wizard lets you:
segment.target: The IExpress Wizard lets you:

segment.source: Decide whether the self-installing package is for administrators or for general employees.
segment.target: Decide whether the self-installing package is for administrators or for general employees.

segment.source: Set multiple ways to run the installation command, such as in normal or silent mode.
segment.target: Set multiple ways to run the installation command, such as in normal or silent mode.

segment.source: Determine whether the IExpress dynamic-link libraries (.dll files) are updated on an employee’s computer.
segment.target: Determine whether the IExpress dynamic-link libraries (.dll files) are updated on an employee’s computer.

segment.source: Determine the compatibility of the installation package, based on the operating system version range, the browser version range, or any application version range.
segment.target: Determine the compatibility of the installation package, based on the operating system version range, the browser version range, or any application version range.

segment.source: Update and add files to the IExpress package, using the UPDFILE tool, without having to rebuild the package.
segment.target: Update and add files to the IExpress package, using the UPDFILE tool, without having to rebuild the package.

segment.source: Replace Runonce with RunOnceEx (if the newer version of Iernonce.dll exists); giving you control over the job run order and status display.
segment.target: Replace Runonce with RunOnceEx (if the newer version of Iernonce.dll exists); giving you control over the job run order and status display.

segment.source: Let corporate administrators set up support for roaming employees.
segment.target: Let corporate administrators set up support for roaming employees.

segment.source: Let Internet Content Providers (ICPs) and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) generate packages for preconfigured desktops with custom, current content.
segment.target: Let Internet Content Providers (ICPs) and Internet Service Providers (ISPs) generate packages for preconfigured desktops with custom, current content.

segment.source: Save disk space by cleaning up the hard drive when running in Setup, uninstallation, and maintenance modes.
segment.target: Save disk space by cleaning up the hard drive when running in Setup, uninstallation, and maintenance modes.

segment.source: Provide support for multiple download sites.
segment.target: Provide support for multiple download sites.

segment.source: Provide support for internal and external development, customization, expandability, and enhanced debugging.
segment.target: Provide support for internal and external development, customization, expandability, and enhanced debugging.

segment.source: Provide support for the extended character set, beyond single-byte characters (SBCS).
segment.target: Provide support for the extended character set, beyond single-byte characters (SBCS).

segment.source: Provide support for using the .inf file format to download Internet components.
segment.target: Provide support for using the .inf file format to download Internet components.

segment.source: For more information, see Use the uninstallation .INF files to uninstall custom components.
segment.target: For more information, see Use the uninstallation .INF files to uninstall custom components.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: IExpress command-line options

segment.target: Internet Explorer Setup command-line options and return codes
